title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Friday 9 December 2016 - BBC News
summary: neglected shih tzu found in leicester .
mckay to captain foxes in white ball cricket .
tigers to name side facing munster .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from leicestershire local live this week - updates will start again on monday at 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : some rain this evening
text: it 'll be dry and cloudy to begin with this evening - later there 's a band of rain pushing in from the north west which will slowly clear in the early hours .
lows of 10c ( 50f ) .
expect a cloudy morning on saturday with scattered showers .
later a more persistent band of rain is moving in from the south west - there 's some uncertainty about how far north the rain will reach but if it does arrive it could be heavy at times .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: travel : breakdown in newarke street underpass
text: breakdown blocking the centre lane as you come through the underpass from newarke street in the city
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester title win astounding - guardiola
text: manchester city manager pep guardiola says leicester 's premier league title win was an `` amazing , astounding '' achievement , ahead of city 's visit to the king power stadium on saturday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: cops carry life-saving kit
text: we now carry a defibrillator in our patrol car in case of medical emergencies .
# firstaid # cpr matt557
this is fantastic !
kudos !
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man arrested after illegal hunting allegations
text: earlier this week i told you about a police investigation into the deaths of some foxes in scalford .
well - police have now told us a 49-year-old man has been arrested .
the man is being questioned on sus of criminal damage , assault and illegal hunting with a dog .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: loughborough park upgraded
text: check out the newly improved cumberland road park in loughborough
the council has spent £ 25,000 upgrading the play equipment .
a play house , slide , climbing frame and a basket swing have been added to the park along with a new table and log seating .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new book debates connections between religion and crime
text: a new book by lecturers from de montfort university is aiming to look at crime through a religious lens .
this was at the launch at dmu 's trinity chapel earlier this week

dr perry stanislas and kim sadique from the community and criminal justice department at dmu have brought together international contributors to try to provide a platform for academic debate on the issue .
kim told me she wanted the book to give a broader context to religion and crime .
author: Kevin Ncube
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: mayor explains budget
text: it was only on tuesday that sir peter soulsby was painting another gloomy of the council 's finances
it that review the `` best news '' was that all the currently proposed cuts to services and spending could reduce the hole in their finances to around £ 40m by 2020 .

the mayor said : `` we 're having to make dramatic cuts in our running costs and our so-called revenue expenditure but we must still be investing the rather separate pot of money that we 've got for capital . ''
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester Political Reporter

documents.title: mayor launches city plan
text: the city mayor has been launching his latest economic action plan for leicester - an upbeat and forward-looking view of the city 's potential .
ambitions over the next four-years include building 6,800 new homes , creating 3,000 new jobs and helping to create 1,000 apprenticeships .
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester Political Reporter

documents.title: barwell cemetery vandalised
text: families have been left distraught after yobs smashed gravestones , funeral arrangements and flowers in barwell cemetery .
author: Hinckley Times

documents.title: watch wbbl cup and bbl action
text: you can follow the live coverage of the wbbl cup semi-finals as leicester riders take on manchester mystics .
the online coverage will then continue as the leicester riders men 's team host bbl leaders newcastle eagles .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: leicester v man city
text: follow live text commentary from the premier league as leicester face man city at the king power stadium on saturday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest headlines for leicestershire
text: latest headlines for leicestershire
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: drivers fined and clamped in leicester
text: leicestershire police joined forces with leicester city council and the driver and vehicle licensing agency earlier this week to target illegal vehicles .
this is one of 14 cars in the belgrave area that was clamped for not having valid road tax
fines were also given to 13 vehicles that were parked illegally and ten drivers were warned for illegal parking .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: festive bin news
text: your # waste and # recycling collection dates will not change this # christmas .
all collections will be made as usual

documents.title: home office delay 'inexcusable '
text: the home office spent nine years deciding whether or not the man should be granted indefinite leave to remain in britain .
the judge said : `` that failure is not explained and it is clear that it was inexcusable '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sikh extremist 'no longer a risk '
text: the judge also lifted a home curfew order so that the man is now free to come and go as he pleases .

he was not entitled to refugee status because of his terrorist activities but the home office accepted that deporting him to india would expose him to a `` real risk '' of torture , inhuman treatment , or even death .

mr justice collins said : `` it seems clear that there is no reason to believe that it would be possible to remove him to india in the foreseeable future and it is clear that he is no longer a risk '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sikh terrorist allowed to stay in leicester
text: a high court judge has ruled a sikh extremist from leicester must be allowed to stay permanently .
the man ( who we ca n't name ) pursued terrorist activities after arriving in the uk in 1995 and was viewed as a national security risk .
but mr justice collins said he now has a british wife and children - and the time had come to let him stay .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tree ready for christmas
text: and it 's complete - what do you think ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: radio team assemble to decorate christmas tree
text: the bbc christmas tree being decorated during jonathan lampon 's radio show
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foster children explain how singing helps them to relax
text: these two boys have been with their foster family for four years now .
the youngest ( in the santa outfit ) is daniel , and he said singing made him feel very calm .
the older boy alex said : `` it makes me relax and it gets my anger out .
i get angry really easily - something happened ages ago , it still makes me angry . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the benefits of singing
text: juliet whitfield is a director for the company running the project - she said : `` singing is amazing , it does amazing things to the body and the brain '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foster children encouraged to sing
text: this group of foster carers and foster children are using singing to transform their lives
this choir is part of a project launched by bullfrog arts and leicester 's education service , which supports singing in the children 's schools and their foster homes .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: getting festive
text: the christmas tree at bbc leicester is being decorated now ( about time ) .
here 's the before
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : tigers name starting fifteen
text: here 's leicester tigers full stating line up
as you can see ben youngs and tom youngs return to the side .
lachlan mccaffrey replaces luke hamilton at no.8 .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: rugby : tuilagi to start for tigers
text: manu tuilagi will start for leicester tigers at munster tomorrow - it 's the first time since he up an injury during the first game of the season .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: your photos : afternoon sunshine in empingham
text: some strong late afternoon sunshine to end the daylight hours in empingham yesterday
another superb upload by andy 's rutland .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: free cash machine ?
text: do you think they took the phrase `` free cash machine '' too literally ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shopper left 'shaken ' by attempted robbery
text: police believe up to five men were involved in the attempted robbery .
detective sergeant mark beniston said : extensive enquiries have been conducted overnight with officers trawling cctv , speaking to witnesses and examining the scene . ''
unbelievably people were inside the store at the time !
police say they 're `` incredibly shaken '' but no one was injured .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: attempted robbery at a supermarket
text: the aldi supermarket near meridian leisure park is cordoned off this morning after a group of men tried to steal the shop 's cash machine last night .
police said they left empty handed but caused `` significant damage to the front of the store '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: what a shih tzu can look like
text: a shih tzu can have long hair and be comfortable - this very well groomed one was a crufts entry in 2008
does it remind anyone else of dougal from the magic roundabout ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : 'the recruitment area is working very hard '
text: the key moments from claudio ranieri 's press conference ahead of saturday 's match against manchester city
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: charity fears other pets may be at risk
text: the rspca has now appealed for help finding the owner of kain - they said he had n't been microchipped .
there 's concern that there could be other neglected animals where he came from .
the charity has asked for anyone with information to contact them on 0300 123 8018 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: vet helps save neglected dog
text: poor kain was in such a state when he was found - he has clearly not been cared for in some time .
his fur was extremely matted .
however he had this clipped at a vets and he looks like a completely different dog now ! ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: neglected shih tzu transformed with a haircut
text: the charity has named the dog kain and have given him a haircut - i ca n't believe how different he looks
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: neglected dog found in leicester
text: this shih tzu has been found in a neglected state on a housing estate in leicester
the rspca say the male was found in braunstone close on thursday last week .
his fur was matted and overgrown , which meant that he was struggling to see .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: care home residents ' christmas night out in hinckley
text: the united reformed church on regent street was also opened up for hot drinks and mince pies
a bbc radio leicester reporter went to see the lights with a coach load of residents from the limes care home .
the home clerk said : `` it 's a fantastic opportunity just for them to come out and see something within the community .
a lot of them are from hinckley originally and have fond memories of the area so they get to see it lit up for christmas . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: hinckley opens pedestrianised road for christmas lights
text: a special viewing of the christmas lights has taken place in hinckley for people who struggle to get into the town centre .
these lights are in an area that 's usually pedestrianised
so , .
the council opened castle street to traffic for one hour to allow those who are less mobile to see the festive display .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: inquest into glider pilot 's death opened
text: it was a brief hearing lasting no more than a few minutes .
the assistant coroner confirmed chris armstrong died on sunday - the retired raf group captain was 70 years old .
a post-mortem examination 's been carried out but there 's no cause of death yet .
the air accidents investigation branch will reveal their findings in six to nine months .
a pre-inquest review will take place next may .
author: Emily Anderson
Reporter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: glenfield hospital support projected onto ramada encore
text: leicester city council 's support for keeping children 's heart surgery at glenfield hospital has now gone up in lights
albeit on a fairly slow rotation with other adverts .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Leicester News Editor

documents.title: more people turning to private ultrasound
text: mike steward from the market harborough company `` ultrasound direct '' said pregnancy was one of the biggest reasons for people wanting scans but there 's a growing market for diagnosing many other health conditions .
he said : `` it is our fastest growing area and i think this is because people are becoming more aware that they can get this service themselves . ''
results are given immediately and are passed onto patient 's doctors .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: are more people turning to private healthcare ?
text: this week we 've been hearing about a backlog for mri scan results at the leicester royal infirmary and other hospitals in the area .
it 's been blamed on problems with a new £ 30m digital imaging system .
radio leicester has been to see a man in market harborough whose company delivers private ultrasounds - to see how this is affecting the private healthcare system .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: players at risk after 'embarrassing ' porto defeat
text: claudio ranieri has said he 's not sure whether those who disappointed in porto on wednesday will get another chance at the club .
the foxes boss said the club 's recruitment department is working very hard , but he wants to look closely at his players before taking any decisions .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cockerill remembers foley ahead of munster match
text: the leicester tigers boss has been talking about their match against munster this weekend - this side 's head coach anthony foley died unexpectedly earlier this season .
`` i can remember last year when we beat them and i bumped into him in the corridor and we had a chat .
we 're quite similar - we 've played for the club , we 've coached the club and both been under extreme pressure .
it just shows that ultimately it is just a game and life is pretty fragile . ''
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: tigers to name cup-match team
text: just after midday leicester tigers will announce their team facing munster in the european rugby champions cup tomorrow .
we 'll bring you the news as soon as we get it .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: new life saving machines for police
text: blaby police have tweeted about getting some new defibrillators for their vehicles
we have taken possession of two new defibrillator machines that will be deployed in vehicles to assist us with saving lives .
great to hear
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mayor addresses changes to leicester 's reputation
text: sir peter soulsby has arrived - he starts positively , saying the collective `` talking down '' of our city is over .
he said : `` we talk about leicester now like we never did '' .
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester Political Reporter

documents.title: businesses gather to hear economic plan
text: it 's filling up here 50+ business reps wanting to find out what the city mayor has in mind for his latest economic plan
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester Political Reporter

documents.title: inquest opening into glider death
text: the inquest into the death of john christopher armstrong will open this morning .
the 70-year-old , known as chris , died when his glider crashed near lubenham on sunday .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester mercury headlines
text: today 's front page - read the headline story here .

it shows two birds watching the sunset in market harborough
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mayor to set out economic priorities
text: i 'm at leicester city hall as the city mayor launches the latest economic action plan
author: Tim Parker
BBC Radio Leicester Political Reporter

documents.title: travel : crash on welford road
text: the a5199 welford road in aylestone is partially blocked and there 's slow traffic in both directions at the knighton lane east junction , because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: leicestershire 's bad five years of t20 cricket
text: clint mckay will have his work cut out - the foxes have n't reached the knockout stages of the t20 competition since they won the tournament in 2011 .
author: Dale Neal
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: east midlands weather forecast
text: east midlands weather forecast
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: can foxes benefit from mckay 's experience and knowledge ?
text: `` we have decided to go in a different direction with the white ball captaincy as we want to maximise clint mckay 's vast experience and knowledge '' .
author: Dale Neal
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: cricket : mckay to captain foxes
text: starting this morning with some big cricket news
the leicestershire bowler clint mckay will captain the foxes in white ball cricket next season .
the decision means mark pettini wo n't lead the foxes in either the one day cup or t20 blast next season .
mark cosgrove will continue to captain the side in the county championship next season .
author: Dale Neal
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: happy friday leicestershire - i hope you 're all well this morning .
i 'll be writing the updates on local live today so keep an eye on this page for all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to comment on any of the day 's stories you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
